label: Behavior 48990408
summary: Vessel behavior pattern: following a curved maritime route forms a small elliptical pattern, approximated by a parametric equation of a circle with radius ~20 meters: lat(t) ≈ 54.4227 + 0.0001 × sin(2πt), lon(t) ≈ 13.6763 + 0.00008 × cos(2πt), where t ∈ [0,1] represents normalized time over the loop; this reflects the vessel turning in place or adjusting position within a confined harbor area, likely during docking preparation or anchoring (the persistent low speed, combined with oscillating COG and stable heading, suggests the vessel is maneuvering in a tight space, possibly awaiting berth assignment or maintaining station despite current/wind effects)
description: Speed profile: stable (the vessel maintains a low and consistent speed between 0.1 and 0.6 knots, indicating minimal propulsion changes)
Course change: fluctuating (COG varies significantly from 1.4° to 348.2°, including sharp shifts near 90° and 209.2°, indicating frequent small adjustments in direction)
Heading fluctuation: stable (despite COG changes, heading remains within a narrow range of 52.0° to 91.0°, suggesting the vessel’s bow orientation is relatively steady)
